text: The Artist is a 2011 French romantic comedy-drama movie. It was produced by Thomas Langmann and was directed by Michel Hazanavicius. The Artist was first shown at the Cannes Film Festival on 15 May 2011 and was released on 12 October 2011 France. The movie gained positive reviews from critics and hold a 98% rating on Rotten Tomatoes. The movie was nominated for 6 Golden Globes and won 3: Best Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy, Best Original Score, and Best Actor – Motion Picture Musical or Comedy (Dujardin). The movie was also nominated for 10 Academy Awards and won 5: Best Picture (first French film to ever win Best Picture), Best Director for Hazanavicius, Best Actor for Dujardin (first French actor ever to win for Best Actor), Best Original Score, and Best Costume Design. == Cast == * Jean Dujardin as George Valentin * Bérénice Bejo as Peppy Miller * Uggie as Jack (the dog) * John Goodman as Al Zimmer * James Cromwell as Clifton * Missi Pyle as Constance * Penelope Ann Miller as Doris Valentin * Malcolm McDowell as The Butler * Bitsie Tulloch as Norma * Beth Grant as Peppy's maid * Ed Lauter as Peppy's first chauffeur * Jen Lilley as Onlooker * Nina Siemaszko as Admiring woman * Jewel Shepard as Flapper starlet * Basil Hoffman as Auctioneer * Ben Kurland as Casting assistant * Ken Davitian as Pawnbroker * Bill Fagerbakke as Policeman * Matt Skollar as Peppy's assistant ==References== == Other websites == * Category:2011 comedy-drama movies Category:2011 romantic comedy movies Category:2011 romantic drama movies Category:Academy Award winning movies Category:French comedy movies Category:French drama movies Category:French romance movies Category:Movies set in Los Angeles Category:Movies set in the 1920s Category:Movies set in the 1930s Category:French silent movies Category:Warner Bros. movies
title: The Artist (movie)
